div.p: Austrian music journal, founded in 1909 by L. Havesi , edited by Richard Specht and Richard Batka, the full title of which was: Der Merker: Österreichische Zeitschrift für Musik und Theater (The Informer [or Critic]: Austrian Newspaper for Music and Theater). It continued publication to 1922, thirteen volumes in all, and contained articles by many critics and writers of the day.

div.head: Der Merker and Schenker
div.p: Correspondence from Ludwig Karpath under the Der Merker letterhead survives as part of OJ 12/9 (1914). Schenker contributed one article to the journal: Heinrich Schenkers Beethoven Ausgabe, Der Merker 7/3 (February 1, 1916), 81–89 (photocopy as OJ 20/6).
